DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: MATTOS, Elizabeth da Costa;MATTOS, ELIZABETH DA COSTA;MATTOS, ELIZABETH COSTA;MATTOS, ELIZABETH;MATTOS, ELIZABETH C.;Mattos, E.C;Mattos, Elizabeth da Costa;DA COSTA MATTOS, ELIZABETH

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui graduao em Engenharia Qumica pela Universidade de Mogi das Cruzes (1989), mestrado em Fsica de Plasmas pelo Instituto Tecnolgico de Aeronutica (2001) e doutorado em Engenharia Aeronutica e Mecnica pelo Instituto Tecnolgico de Aeronutica (2007). Atualmente pesquisadora do Departamento de Cincia e Tecnologia Aeroespacial (DCTA) - Instituto de Aeronutica e Espao (IAE) e professora permanente do Instituto Tecnolgico de Aeronutica (ITA). Tem experincia na rea de Engenharia Qumica, com nfase em Processos Orgnicos, atuando principalmente nos seguintes temas: sntese de materiais energticos, explosivos plsticos , desenvolvimento de metodologias por FT-IR usando tcnicas de transmisso, reflexo (DRIFT, MIC, ATR e UATR) e deteco Fotoacstica na identificao e quantificao de materiais energticos, anlise trmica, cromatografia (HPLC).
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: bachelor's at Engenharia Qumica from Universidade de Mogi das Cruzes (1989), master's at Aerospace Engineering from Instituto Tecnolgico de Aeronutica (2001) and doctorate at Mechanical Engineering from Instituto Tecnolgico de Aeronutica (2007). Has experience in Chemical Engineering, focusing on Organic Processes, acting on the following subjects: hmx, ft-ir, energetic material, materiais enegticos and dsc.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Evaluation of NIR spectroscopy for amine characterization in bonding agents used in solid propellants.

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MATTOS, Elizabeth da Costa;MATTOS, ELIZABETH DA COSTA;MATTOS, ELIZABETH COSTA;MATTOS, ELIZABETH;MATTOS, ELIZABETH C.;Mattos, E.C;Mattos, Elizabeth da Costa;DA COSTA MATTOS, ELIZABETH

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: Materiais e Processos para Engenharia Aeronutica e Aeroespacial

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Administrao pblica, defesa e seguridade social

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Propellant formulations are composed from several compds. that all influence the properties during prepn. and also the final system properties like adhesion, insulation, combustion characteristics, rheol. and mech. properties. Among these products are the bonding agents that due to its reactivity and specific characteristics contribute significantly in the acquisition of the desired properties. The bonding agent has the important role to promote the interaction between the solid fillers (ammonium perchlorate and aluminum) and the binder matrix by joining them and not allowing the particles to become loose in the polymer binder. The bonding agent is considered as a strategic product in the industry of solid propellants due to its importance and influence in the grain propellant, therefore the synthesis and properties of it are kept secret. Bonding agents are compds. with functional groups such as aziridine amides (hydroxylated or not), amines (di and tri-hydroxalated), amines (cyano-hydroxylated), amides (di-hydroxylated) among others. In this work, the bonding agent that is object of our study belongs to the class of cyanoethylated amines, named partially cyanoethylated tetraethylenepentamine (TEPAN). This amine-based product, such as tetraethylenepentamine (TEPA), interacts with AP of the propellant grain by an ionic mechanism, as it has been proposed by Hori. NH4ClO4 + H2N(CH2CH2NH)3CH2CH2NH2 NH3 + H3N+(CH2CH2NH)3CH2CH2NH2[ClO4]-. The probability of having three kinds of amines (primary, secondary and tertiary), and each of them having different reactivity brings up the interest for the development of a simple and fast method to evaluate the presence of these amines. This constitutes an important tool for the knowledge of the structure and the properties of the bonding agent that is used in propellant formulations. The Fourier Transformed IR Spectroscopy (FT-IR) in the regions of MIR and NIR is a technique that has been used in our labs.
for character

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Quantitative determination of TNT and HNS by TG and FT-IR

AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: MATTOS, Elizabeth da Costa;MATTOS, ELIZABETH DA COSTA;MATTOS, ELIZABETH COSTA;MATTOS, ELIZABETH;MATTOS, ELIZABETH C.;Mattos, E.C;Mattos, Elizabeth da Costa;DA COSTA MATTOS, ELIZABETH

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-SUB-AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO: Materiais e Processos para Engenharia Aeronutica e Aeroespacial

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: 2,4,6-trinitrotoluene (TNT) is an energetic material that shows scarce crystalline properties that can be improved by addition of 2,2',4,4',6,6'-hexanitrostilbene (HNS) in the crystallization process. HNS is a very important high explosive used in a variety of military, aerospace and industrial formulations owing to its suitable properties. It is in insensitive and thermal stable explosive that can be produced from 2,4.6-trinitrotoluene (TNT). The purpose of this work is the quantitative determination of HNS and TNT in explosives by thermogravimetric analysis (TG) and Fourier transform infrared spectroscopy (FT-IR).
